sage.camera.controllers

Class FPCameraController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.camera.controllers.AbstractCameraController
      • sage.camera.controllers.FPCameraController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener, ICameraController

    public class FPCameraController
extends AbstractCameraController
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This class extends the AbstractCameraController class and the MouseMotionListener interface. This class controls the virtual ICamera such that it functions as a "first-person camera" common in first person video games. This class controls the pitch and yaw of the camera and how those actions relate to the target's rotation. The controller does NOT control the SceneNode position of the target which it is attached to.

    NOTE: If a mouse is being used as the primary input device, this class automatically adds itself as a mouse motion listener to the display system's renderer's canvas.

    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett

                          IInputManager inputMgr,
                          java.lang.String inputControllerName)
        Constructs a FPSCameraController which controls the specified ICamera and it attached to a SceneNode target.
        Parameters:
        camera - - The camera to control
        target - - The target the controller is attached to
        inputMgr - - The IInputManager which provides access to controllers
        inputControllerName - - the name of the controller containing the components which manipulate the first-person camera

    • Method Detail

      • getIsCameraRollEnabled

        public boolean getIsCameraRollEnabled()
        Returns true if the camera is allowed to "roll" (global yaw is disabled); false if camera "roll" is not allowed (global yaw is enabled).

      • enableCameraRoll

        public void enableCameraRoll()
        Enables the camera to "roll" about its N axis by disabling global yawing. I.E. it is a first person "flight" camera with six degrees of freedom.

      • disableCameraRoll

        public void disableCameraRoll()
        Disables the camera to "roll" about its N axis by enabling global yawing.

      • getIsTargetRotationEnabled

        public boolean getIsTargetRotationEnabled()
        Returns true if the camera controller automatically rotates the target based on "yaw" input; false if this functionality has been disabled.

        Enables the camera controller to rotate the target based on "yaw" input.
